DataElement.preferredName: Other Relative Biomarker Analysis Positive Finding Name
DataElement.preferredDefinition: A response to capture the names of positive biological assays for other persons that are related by blood or marriage.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Other Relative Biomarker Analysis Positive Finding
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: Different than the one(s) previously specified or mentioned._A person related by blood or marriage._A method of biological assay that looks for the presence of unique molecules or sequences considered indicative for a condition or state._A finding of abnormality following an examination or observation confirming something, such as the presence of a disease, condition, or microorganism.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: Different than the one(s) previously specified or mentioned.:A person related by blood or marriage.:A method of biological assay that looks for the presence of unique molecules or sequences considered indicative for a condition or state.

Concepts.definition: Different than the one(s) previously specified or mentioned.
A person related by blood or marriage.
A method of biological assay that looks for the presence of unique molecules or sequences considered indicative for a condition or state.

Property.preferredDefinition:
An observation confirming something, such as the
presence of a disease, condition, or microorganism.

Concepts.definition: A finding of abnormality following an examination or observation confirming something, such as the presence of a disease, condition, or microorganism.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: A functional unit of heredity which occupies a specific position (locus) on a particular chromosome, is capable of reproducing itself exactly at each cell division, and directs the formation of a protein or other product. The gene as a functional unit consists of a discrete segment of a giant DNA molecule containing the purine (adenine and guanine) and pyrimidine (cytosine and thymine) bases in the ordered and correct sequence that encodes a specific functional product (i.e., a protein or RNA molecule).

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: This gene plays a critical role in cell cycle regulation and has tumor suppressor activity.

Concepts.definition: This gene plays a critical role in cell cycle regulation and has tumor suppressor activity.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: This gene plays a role in signal transduction and apoptosis. It is also involved in the regulation of cell cycle progression.

Concepts.definition: This gene plays a role in signal transduction and apoptosis. It is also involved in the regulation of cell cycle progression.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: BRCA2 putatively functions as a tumor suppressor gene, however, its exact function has not been well characterized. The similarity of, and functional analysis of, BRCA2 and BRCA1 proteins, suggests that these proteins function in the same genetic pathway. BRCA1 and BRCA2 have transcriptional activation potential and the two proteins are associated with the activation of double-strand break repair and/or homologous recombination. The two proteins have been shown to coexist and colocalize in a biochemical complex. (from LocusLink)

Concepts.definition: This gene is involved in cell cycle control, DNA repair and the maintenance of genomic stability. It also plays a role in the proliferation of embryonic cells.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: This gene plays a role in cell cycle control, regulation of transcription and the maintenance of genomic stability. It is also involved in the inhibition of mammary cell growth.

Concepts.definition: This gene plays a role in cell cycle control, regulation of transcription and the maintenance of genomic stability. It is also involved in the inhibition of mammary cell growth.

ValueMeaning.changeDescription: Updated definition to match NCIt. mc 6.10.19
